citation.article-title: Marinifilum fragile gen. nov., sp. nov., isolated from tidal flat sediment
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Marinifilum fragile sp. nov.
Marinifilum fragile (fra′gi.le. L. neut. adj. fragile fragile).
Displays the following properties in addition to those given in the genus description.
Cells are initially filamentous, becoming spherical in aged cultures.
Filaments are generally 0.5 μm wide and variable in length, with a 0.3–3.8 μm long flagella-like structure at the end.
Colonies on MA are circular, in some cases with erose edges, and ivory or brownish ivory coloured.
Growth occurs at pH 6–8 (optimum pH 7) and 20–37.4 °C (optimum 33 °C).
Does not grow with 0–9 % (w/v) NaCl alone.
Utilizes glycerol, galactose, glucose, N-acetylglucosamine, maltose, lactose, melibiose and starch, but not turanose, d-xylose, fructose, gentiobiose, glycogen, mannose or mannitol.
Produces β-galactosidase, gelatinase, alkaline phosphatase, trypsin, acid phosphatase and N-acetyl-β-glucosaminidase.
Indole is produced, but H2S is not.
The major fatty acid is iso-C15 : 0.
The type strain is JC2469T (=IMSNU 14138T =KCTC 22488T =JCM 15579T), isolated from tidal flat sediment of Yeocha, Ganghwa Island, South Korea.
